src:
Gas Septic Tank Bisa Hasilkan Ledakan, Ini Penjelasannya
05 Nov 2019, 08:14 by Anwar Siswadi (Kontributor), Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Septic Tank disebut menyimpan berbagai kandungan gas yang bisa menimbulkan ledakan. Peneliti biogas untuk listrik Lembaga Ilmu Pengetahuan Indonesia, Aep Saepudin, menyatakan bahwa masyarakat harus berhati-hati memperlakukan tempat pembuangan tinja tersebut.
Aep menyatakan bahwa ledakan yang terjadi di Cakung, Jakarta Timur, Senin kemarin sangat mungkin disulut oleh kandungan gas dalam septic tank. Menurutnya limbah yang tertampung di dalam septic tank mengalami proses pengolahan secara biologis yang dilakukan oleh mikroorganisme. Proses penguraian limbah ini menghasilkan uap air dan gas seperti metana, karbondioksida, hidrogen sulfida, amoniak, dan lain-lain.
“Gas-gas inilah yang menjadi penyebab utama dari kasus meledaknya septic tank,” ujarnya kepada Tempo di Bandung, Selasa 5 November 2019.
Dari beragam gas tersebut, menurut dia, Metana merupakan gas yang paling mudah terbakar. Metana merupakan senyawa hidrokarbon fraksi ringan yang mempunyai karakteristik gampang terbakar. Oleh sebab itu, gas ini biasa digunakan dalam pembuatan gas alam atau LNG (Liquid Natural Gas). Metana dalam jumlah yang sedikit tidak menimbulkan potensi bahaya apapun selain bau busuk yang menyengat.
Supaya bau metana tidak terhirup manusia, perlu dipasang saluran pembuangan gas dengan tinggi lubang mengeluarkan di atas dua meter. Jika metana yang ada di dalam septic tank terjebak karena tidak adanya saluran pembuangan gas, akumulasi jumlahnya akan bertambah.
“Ketika sudah mencapai kadar tertentu, gas tersebut dapat menimbulkan bahaya ledakan yang besar,” ujarnya.
Karena itu, dia mengimbau agar masyarakat tidak menyalakan api di dekat septic tank. Dia menduga kejadian ledakan di Cakung kemarin karena petugas penyedot sempat menyalakan api dengan membakar koran dan memasukkannya ke dalam septic tank.
“Tidak boleh menyulutkan api,” kata Aep.
Kemarin, septic tank meledak menghebohkan warga Kavling 0 RT 16/ RW 03 Kelurahan Jatinegara, Cakung, Jakarta Timur. Petugas penyedot berinisial S tewas karena terhempas ledakan hingga terperosok ke lubang septic tank dan tertindih puing beton. Korban tewas saat dilarikan ke Rumah Sakit Jayakarta.
text:
Gas Septic Tanks Can Produce Explosions, Here's the Explanation
05 Nov 2019, 08:14 by Anwar Siswadi (Contributor), Febriyan
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Septic Tank is said to store various gas contents which can cause an explosion. A biogas researcher for electricity at the Indonesian Institute of Sciences, Aep Saepudin, stated that the community must be careful about treating the faeces.
Aep stated that the explosion that occurred in Cakung, East Jakarta, on Monday, was very likely ignited by the gas content in a septic tank. According to him, the waste collected in the septic tank undergoes a biological treatment process carried out by microorganisms. This decomposition process produces waste water vapor and gases such as methane, carbon dioxide, hydrogen sulfide, ammonia, and others.
"These gases are the main cause of the explosion of the septic tank," he told Tempo in Bandung, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Of the various gases, according to him, Methane is the most flammable gas. Methane is a mild fraction hydrocarbon compound that has flammable characteristics. Therefore, this gas is commonly used in the manufacture of natural gas or LNG (Liquid Natural Gas). Small amounts of methane do not pose any potential harm other than strong odor.
In order for the smell of methane not to be inhaled by humans, it is necessary to install a gas drain with a hole high above two meters. If the methane in the septic tank is trapped due to the absence of a gas drain, the accumulated amount will increase.
"When it reaches a certain level, the gas can pose a great explosion danger," he said.
Therefore, he appealed to the public not to light a fire near the septic tank. He suspected the explosion incident in Cakung yesterday because the vacuum staff had lit a fire by burning a newspaper and put it in a septic tank.
"You can't light a fire," Aep said.
Yesterday, a septic tank exploded horrifying residents of Kavling 0 RT 16 / RW 03 Kelurahan Jatinegara, Cakung, East Jakarta. The suction officer with the initial S died as a result of being blown away by an explosion which plunged into a septic tank pit and was crushed by concrete debris. The victim died when he was rushed to Jayakarta Hospital.
